Package game

Class Corpse

java.lang.Object
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Item
game.PortableItem
game.Corpse
All Implemented Interfaces:
Capable, Printable, edu.monash.fit2099.interfaces.ItemInterface
public class Corpse
extends PortableItem
Corpse class. Created after human is killed. It will be removed after the Corpse has resurrected.
Author:
leong

  • Constructor Details

    • Corpse

      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • tick

      public void tick​(Location currentLocation)
      Inform the corpse item the passage of time (turn). The default turns for a Corpse to resurrect is 7. If in the current tick, turns == 0, then the function will check if there is any actor on the place where the Corpse is placed. If yes, set current location to East South spot (x + 1, y + 1). If x and y exceeds the map limit, current x / y will be set to the beginning (using remainder). Then, A new Zombie object will be placed in that location. If turn != 0, turn will be decreased by 1.
      Overrides:
      tick in class Item
      Parameters:
      currentLocation - location of the Corpse

    • getPickUpAction

      public PickUpItemAction getPickUpAction()
      Description copied from class: Item
      Create and return an action to pick this Item up. If this Item is not portable, returns null.
      Overrides:
      getPickUpAction in class Item
      Returns:
      a new PickUpItemAction if this Item is portable, null otherwise.
